content.text: Shade one more small square so that the diagram has one line of symmetry.
Shade one more small square so that the diagram has rotational symmetry of order 2 .
2 The scale drawing shows the positions of two villages, \(P\) and \(Q\).
The scale is 1 cm represents 0.5 km .
(a) Find the actual distance between village \(P\) and village \(Q\).
km [2]
(b) Measure the bearing of village \(Q\) from village \(P\).
The diagram shows two straight lines intersecting two parallel lines.
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\).
Samira picks one of these cards at random and replaces it.
(a) Find the probability that she picks an odd number.
(b) Samira repeats this 35 times.
Calculate the number of times Samira is expected to pick an odd number.
(a) Translate triangle \(T\) by the vector \(\binom{0}{-2}\).
(b) Describe fully the single transformation that maps triangle \(T\) onto triangle \(U\).
6 Solve.
7 These are the first 4 terms of a sequence.
(a) Find the next term of this sequence.
(b) Find the \(n\)th term of this sequence.
8 Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 36 and 54 .
\(9 \quad A\) is the point \((3,-1)\) ． \(\overrightarrow{A B}=\binom{2}{-4}\)
（a）\(\overrightarrow{A C}=2 \overrightarrow{A B}\)
Find the coordinates of the point \(C\).
（b）The length of \(A B\) is \(k \sqrt{5}\) ．
Find the value of \(k\) ．
（c）\(P\) is a point on \(A B\) ．
Find the position vector of \(P\) ．
The diagram shows a sector of a circle, centre \(O\). The length of the arc is \(n \pi \mathrm{~cm}\).
Find the value of \(n\).
11 (a) Write \(0.007 \ 08\) in standard form.
(b) Work out \((3.8 \times 10^{22})+(3.8 \times 10^{23})\). Give your answer in standard form.
\(P, Q\) and \(R\) lie on a circle． \(Q R\) is a diameter．
Find angle \(P R Q\) ． Give geometrical reasons for your answer．
13 (a) 100 students solve a puzzle. The table shows information about the time taken by each student to solve the puzzle.

(ii) Complete the histogram to show the information in the table.

solve the puzzle.

content.text: (i) On the grid, draw a cumulative frequency diagram.
(ii) Use your cumulative frequency diagram to find an estimate for
(a) the median s [1]
(b) the lower quartile. s [1]
14 Write \(0.2 \dot{5}\) as a fraction.
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=\frac{2}{x}-1\).
(a) Write down the coordinates of the point where the graph crosses the \(x\)-axis.
(b) Write down the equation of each asymptote.
(c) By drawing a suitable straight line on the grid, solve \(\frac{2}{x}-x-1=0\).
The diagram shows a solid made by joining a hemisphere to a cylinder. The radius of both the hemisphere and the cylinder is 6 cm .
The height of the cylinder is 5 cm .
Find the total surface area of the solid. Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\).
17 Find the value of
18 (a) \(\frac{9}{\sqrt{3}}\) Rationalise the denominator. Give your answer in its simplest form.
Find the value of \(c\) and the value of \(k\).
\(20 y \alpha \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}}\)
Find the value of \(y\) when \(x=36\).
(b) When \(x\) is increased by a factor of 4 , the value of \(y\) changes by a factor of \(p\).
Find the value of \(p\).
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=3 x-x^{3}\). The graph crosses the \(x\)-axis at \(A\), at \(O\) and at \(B\).
The turning points of the graph are at \(P\) and at \(Q\).
(a) Find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) and the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\). Give your answers as exact values.
\(x\)-coordinate of \(A\)
\(x\)-coordinate of \(B\)
(b) (i) Differentiate \(3 x-x^{3}\).
(ii) Find the coordinates of \(P\) and \(Q\).
22 (a) Write down the exact value of \(\tan 60^{\circ}\).
(b) Solve \(2 \sin x-1=0\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).
NOT TO SCALE
In the diagram, \(O A\) is parallel to \(B C\). \(B C=3 O A\)
\(M\) is the midpoint of \(A C\). The position vector of \(A\) is \(\mathbf{a}\) and the position vector of \(B\) is \(\mathbf{b}\).
Find the position vector of \(M\). Give your answer in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\), in its simplest form.
24 The line \(y=7 x+3\) intersects the curve \(y=x^{2}+5 x-12\) at the points \(A\) and \(B\).
Find the coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).
